thread.title: Bookies slash the odds on Leicester to win the Champions League after famous night at King Power
thread.title_full: Bookies slash the odds on Leicester to win the Champions League after famous night at King Power

author: rforrester
title: Bookies slash the odds on Leicester to win the Champions League after famous night at King Power
text:
Against the odds Bookies slash the odds on Leicester to win the Champions League after famous night at King Power 
Foxes can be backed at 25/1 to go all the way but Barcelona remain favourites By Richard Forrester 14th March 2017, 11:15 pm Updated: 15th March 2017, 12:18 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LEICESTER CITY’S odds of winning the Champions League have been slashed by bookies after their heroic night at the King Power Stadium. 
Against all the odds, the Foxes booked their place in the last eight of Europe’s most prestigious tournament after defeating Sevilla 2-0. Richard Pelham/Sun 3 Leicester can be backed at 25/1 to go all the way and win the Champions League 
They headed into the second-leg looking to turn around a 2-1 deficit against the Europa League holders but goals from captain Wes Morgan and Marc Albrighton sealed the most unlikely of turnarounds. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Leicester news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And the bookies now believe at a price of 25/1 that they can go all the way and lift the trophy at the Principality Stadium in May. 
Supporters believe anything is possible after they were crowned Premier League champions last season. 
Craig Shakespeare’s side were 80/1 before knocking out Sevilla and will now mingle with Europe’s top dogs in the last eight. Champions League outright odds with SunBets 
Barcelona 11/4 Barcelona are favourites following their stunning turnaround against PSG most read TERRY 'THIEVES' IN COURT Three men face trial over a burglary at John Terry's £5m home and six other properties HARRY PAIN Spurs confirm Harry Kane suffered 'ligament damage' to ankle but have slim hope he could play again this season 'LOL' Banned defender Tyrone Mings in disbelief as Marcos Rojo escapes punishment after stamp on Eden Hazard NEIL CUSTIS Paul Pogba is trying too hard to live up to £89million price tag and needs to do the simple things well Lothar's Lowdown Pep Guardiola will not make same mistakes as Unai Emery did, and Leroy Sane could be the difference Special Seat Pep Guardiola wants to storm past Monaco as Man City boss prepares to join Champions League elite NOT-SO-SAFE HANDS Juventus goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon admits he wants to avoid Leicester in quarter-finals GEE WES We pulled off the impossible... again! Wes Morgan delighted as Leicester reach Champions League quarter-finals 'I’m not motivated by money' Paul Konchesky is relishing the prospect of playing regular football for Billericay Town DAVE KIDD Paul Pogba might be the £89m man - but he was schooled by France team-mate N'Golo Kante Would You Take This Woman? Nick gives evidence at Kate's murder trial - and is put on the spot by a question from her barrister... Kante Keep Him Away N'Golo Kante celebrates Leicester's Champions League win over Sevilla from King Power stands Amazing atmosphere as Leicester fans celebrate Champions League qualification Getty Images 3 Bayern Munich are second favourites following their thrashing of Arsenal 
Unsurprisingly they are still ranked big outsiders with the likes of Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Juventus and Real Madrid still in the hat. 
Barcelona remain favourites with SunBets to be crowned champions of Europe after their unbelievable turnaround against Paris Saint-Germain. 
Manchester City still have work to do to get past Monaco but they are 12/1 to go all the way. Leicester fans celebrate Sevilla win and reaching the Champions League quarter-finals
